title: Coffee Jelly Recipe
description: Coffee jelly is a favorite Japanese dessert that's easy to make at home with brewed coffee, gelatin, and sugar for a refreshing after-dinner treat.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Japanese Coffee Jelly 4.6 (61) 47 Reviews 17 Photos This coffee jelly is a refreshing Japanese summertime treat made with coffee, powdered gelatin, and sugar. My favorite way to serve it is with frozen whipped cream and chocolate sauce, although it's also delicious with ice cream, regular whipped cream, or flavored coffee cream. It can be served solid in glasses or cubed in bowls. Submitted by Sarah Updated on June 27, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 17 17 17 17 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Additional Time: 6 hrs Total Time: 6 hrs 10 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons hot water 1 (.25 ounce) package unflavored gelatin 2 cups fresh brewed coffee 3 tablespoons white sugar Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir together gelatin and hot water in a small bowl until gelatin dissolves; pour into a saucepan. Stir in coffee and sugar, and bring to a boil over high heat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour coffee mixture into a shallow, 9-inch square or 7x11-inch baking dish. Chill in the refrigerator until solidified, 6 to 7 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cut coffee jelly into cubes to serve. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tip For individual servings instead of cubes, pour the hot coffee mixture into four individual glasses instead of one large baking dish, then chill as directed in Step 3. I Made It Print 137 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. Add Your Photo Photos of Coffee Jelly 01 of 17 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 17 Photo by  TrendyRum6813 06/18/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Worth the effort This is a keeper! I was a bit more generous with the sugar and I’m unsure if it’ll completely set up because I had trouble dissolving the gelatine, but I tried some after about 2 hours and it was so good! I added half and half along with cocoa powder and cinnamon on top, and it was great! This will be a regular in my house.Edit: I use Kcups to brew my coffee. I tried dissolving the gelatine (I used Knox brand) in about a quarter cup of freshly brewed coffee and it worked much better. The label on the Knox brand calls for a quarter cup as well. Something to consider :) I made a new batch because I ended up eating half of the one I had made! I put Starbucks cinnamon half&half on top along with cinnnamon and cocoa powder. It added a perfect sweetness to the jelly. Yum!! 03 of 17 Photo by  Doremon1380 08/30/2022 04 of 17 Photo by  Cindy 06/18/2021 05 of 17 Photo by  Yoly 03/14/2021 I really liked this. So easy and so simple. Will make again. Thanks for sharing your recipe! 06 of 17 Photo by  Teresa Wilson 02/27/2021 07 of 17 Photo by  Kat Brown 08/30/2020 This is also delicious cubed and served in a martini glass with a Starbucks Doubleshot for breakfast, or with Bailey's Irish Cream as an after dinner treat. I add a dollop of whipped cream and shaved semisweet chocolate to mine. 08 of 17 Photo by  Cheryl Langley Covey 09/27/2019 We served it with condensed milk and it was delicious! 09 of 17 Photo by  Melissa Neeley 07/22/2019 Was extremely yummy! Serving it with whipped cream gave it that extra dessert taste. 10 of 17 Photo by  Lea Leopard 09/26/2018 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Black Sesame Pudding 1 Rating Microwave Chi Chi Dango Japanese Sweet Omelet 6 Ratings Furutsu Sando (Fruit Sandwiches) 1 Rating Coffee Gelatin Dessert 18 Ratings Green Tea Layer Cake 163 Ratings Marshmallow Cake 43 Ratings Azuki Ice Cream (Japanese Red Beans Ice Cream) 10 Ratings Pumpkin Mochi 95 Ratings Mizu Shingen Mochi with Strawberry Compote The Best Japanese Dessert Recipes Butter Mochi Cake 21 Ratings Manju (Japanese Sweet Bean Paste Cookies) 4 Ratings Cucumber and Avocado Sushi 61 Ratings Japanese Egg Salad Sandwich 15 Ratings Grilled Chicken Teriyaki Skewers with Miso Ranch 19 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
